author: 0x6c
content: can a smart contract support asymmetric key exchanges?

author: 0x6c
content: i.e. implement a handshake at the start of any sequence, to enable privacy?

author: 0x6c
content: or is that an unfeasonably expensive amount of computation or something?

author: pipermerriam
content: In general it isn't simple for a smart contract to "keep secrets".

author: 0x6c
content: because any private keys it would generate would be visible to all?

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, anything that a smart contract does is "visible" and thus, the only way that I'm aware for them to have a secret is using "math magic" (snarky stuff, homomorphic encryption, etc), which are all complex topics.

author: 0x6c
content: but perhaps not an intractable problem, if such complex solutions work

author: 0x6c
content: i guess i've got some reading to do on math magic. thanks
